rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1988, Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">nutrition, health services, and safe water</cite> to vulnerable populations globally. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="2">$54,067,823 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Mercy-USA is particularly distinguished by its <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund its service delivery models. Their work spans critical regions including <cite id="4">Somalia, Syria, Yemen, and Gaza</cite>, focusing on both immediate emergency relief and long-term development. In Somalia, the organization has achieved significant success in public health, maintaining <cite id="5">high TB cure rates</cite> through its specialized centers. Beyond healthcare, Mercy-USA addresses infrastructure needs, having <cite id="6">rehabilitated cisterns serving 10,000 people</cite> and constructed <cite id="7">950 modular homes</cite> for displaced families. The organization maintains a <cite id="8">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and an <cite id="9">overall score of 92.92.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong governance and accountability standards.
